intro: Echium acanthocarpum, commonly known as the spiked fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking spikes of blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in coastal areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branched. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, contributing to its ability to spread in suitable environments.
